abstract: Lisa Lutz Lives essay describes meeting her biological parents, who had given her up for adoption, only to discover that she would have preferred getting a nice dossier on them. Drawing (M)/
lead_paragraph: I was young, maybe 4, when I learned where babies came from. I was sitting on a leopard-print couch in my mom's bachelorette apartment, and her friend decided on a whim to read to me that seminal '70s book on the nitty-gritty of conception, ''Where Did I Come From?'' I remember experiencing a gag reflex and wanting to plug my ears and sing lalalalalalala. ''Ewww, that is so gross,'' I said.
